DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim is to utilize near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) in patients under general anesthesia to measure changes in brain blood flow in the bilateral somatosensory cortices and the prefrontal cortices in response to noxious stimulation.
DOC.brief_title: Assessing the Cortical Response to Noxious and Auditory Stimuli Using Near Infrared Spectroscopy in Subjects Under General Anesthesia
DOC.criteria: 1230 years of age Structurally normal heart Righthanded Englishspeaking Unable to cooperate or understand the study Neurologic disease Diabetes mellitus Syndrome of greater than minor severity. Smoker Scalp or hair does not permit sufficient optical light detection Unable to keep his/her head still for a period of 200 consecutive seconds
